DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the study is to compare clinical outcomes from PRK and SBK using FDA-approved laser technology in the same patient
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Photorefractive Keratectomy (PRK) and Sub-Bowman's Keratomileusis (SBK)
DOC.detailed_description: Patients undergoing bilateral laser refractive surgery on the same day will be randomly assigned to have one eye treated with PRK and the fellow eye treated with SBK.
DOC.criteria: Patients deemed to be suitable candidates for bilateral LASIK surgery Patients who desire monovision correction rather than bilateral distance correction
